summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Gets various flags that describe the media item.

param.name: pCharacteristics
param.para: Receives a bitwise OR of flags from the enumeration.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.GetDuration

summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Gets the duration of the media item.

param.name: guidPositionType
param.para: Specifies the unit of time for the duration value. The following value is defined.

description.para: The value returned in pvDurationValue is a LARGE_INTEGER.

param.name: pvDurationValue
param.para: Pointer to a PROPVARIANT that receives the duration.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The method returns the total duration of the content, regardless of any values set through .

member.seealso: How to Get the Playback Duration

summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Gets a pointer to the MFPlay player object that created the media item.

param.name: ppMediaPlayer
param.para: Receives a pointer to the player object's interface. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Gets a property store that contains metadata for the source, such as author or title.

param.name: ppMetadataStore
param.para: Receives a pointer to the IPropertyStore interface of a read-only property store. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Gets the number of streams (audio, video, and other) in the media item.

param.name: pdwStreamCount
param.para: Receives the number of streams.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Gets the object that was used to create the media item.

param.name: ppIUnknown
param.para: Receives a pointer to the object's IUnknown interface. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The media item was created from a URL, not from an object.

remarks.para: The object pointer is set if the application uses to create the media item. Otherwise, GetObject returns MF_E_NOTFOUND.

summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Queries the media item for a presentation attribute.

param.name: guidMFAttribute
param.para: GUID that identifies the attribute value to query.
For a list of presentation attributes, see Presentation Descriptor Attributes.

param.name: pvValue
param.para: Pointer to a PROPVARIANT that receives the value. The method fills the PROPVARIANT with a copy of the stored value. Call PropVariantClear to free the memory allocated by the method.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Presentation attributes describe the presentation as a whole. To get an attribute that applies to an individual stream within the presentation, call .

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.GetStartStopPosition

summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Gets the start and stop times for the media item.

param.name: pguidStartPositionType
param.para: Receives the unit of time for the start position. See Remarks. This parameter can be NULL.

param.name: pvStartValue
param.para: Receives the start position. The meaning and data type of this parameter are indicated by the pguidStartPositionType parameter. The pvStartValue parameter must be NULL if pguidStartPositionType is NULL, and cannot be NULL otherwise.

param.name: pguidStopPositionType
param.para: Receives the unit of time for the stop position. See Remarks. This parameter can be NULL.

param.name: pvStopValue
param.para: Stop position. The meaning and data type of this parameter are indicated by the pguidStopPositionType parameter. The pvStopValue parameter must be NULL if pguidStopPositionType is NULL, and cannot be NULL otherwise.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The pguidStartPositionType and pguidStopPositionType parameters receive the units of time that are used. Currently, the only supported value is MFP_POSITIONTYPE_100NS.

item.description:
100-nanosecond units. The time parameter (pvStartValue or pvStopValue) uses the following data type:
Variant type (vt): VT_I8
Variant member: hVal

member.seealso: How to Play a File Clip

summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Queries the media item for a stream attribute.

param.name: dwStreamIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the stream. To get the number of streams, call .

param.name: guidMFAttribute
param.para: GUID that identifies the attribute value to query. Possible values are listed in the following topics:

param.name: pvValue
param.para: Pointer to a PROPVARIANT that receives the value. The method fills the PROPVARIANT with a copy of the stored value. Call PropVariantClear to free the memory allocated by this method.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Stream attributes describe an individual stream (audio, video, or other) within the presentation. To get an attribute that applies to the entire presentation, call .

summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Queries whether a stream is selected to play.

param.name: dwStreamIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the stream. To get the number of streams, call .

param.name: pfEnabled
param.para: Receives a Boolean value.

description.para: The stream is selected. During playback, this stream will play.
The stream is not selected. During playback, this stream will not play.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To select or deselect a stream, call .

summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Gets the URL that was used to create the media item.

param.name: ppwszURL
param.para: Receives a pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the URL. The caller must free the string by calling .

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: No URL is associated with this media item.

remarks.para: This method applies when the application calls to create a media item. If the application calls to create a media item, the GetURL method for that media item returns MF_E_NOTFOUND.

summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Gets the application-defined value stored in the media item.

param.name: pdwUserData
param.para: Receives the application-defined value for the media item.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: You can assign this value when you first create the media item, by specifying it in the dwUserData parameter of the or method. To update the value, call .
This method can be called after the player object is shut down.

summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Queries whether the media item contains an audio stream.

param.name: pfHasAudio
param.para: Receives the value TRUE if the media item contains at least one audio stream, or FALSE otherwise.

param.name: pfSelected
param.para: Receives the value TRUE if at least one audio stream is selected, or FALSE otherwise.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To select or deselect streams before playback starts, call .

summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Queries whether the media item contains a video stream.

param.name: pfHasVideo
param.para: Receives the value TRUE if the media item contains at least one video stream, or FALSE otherwise.

param.name: pfSelected
param.para: Receives the value TRUE if at least one video stream is selected, or FALSE otherwise.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To select or deselect streams before playback starts, call .

summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Queries whether the media item contains protected content. Note Currently does not support playing protected content.

param.name: pfProtected
param.para: Receives one of the following values.

description.para: The media item contains protected content. Attempting to play this media item will cause a playback error.
The media item does not contain protected content.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFPMediaItem.SetStartStopPosition

summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Sets the start and stop time for the media item.

param.name: pguidStartPositionType
param.para: Unit of time for the start position. See Remarks. This parameter can be NULL.

param.name: pvStartValue
param.para: Start position. The meaning and data type of this parameter are indicated by the pguidStartPositionType parameter. The pvStartValue parameter must be NULL if pguidStartPositionType is NULL, and cannot be NULL otherwise.

param.name: pguidStopPositionType
param.para: Unit of time for the stop position. See Remarks. This parameter can be NULL.

param.name: pvStopValue
param.para: Stop position. The meaning and data type of this parameter are indicated by the pguidStopPositionType parameter. The pvStopValue parameter must be NULL if pguidStopPositionType is NULL, and cannot be NULL otherwise.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: Invalid start or stop time. Any of the following can cause this error:

item.description: Time greater than the total duration of the media item.
Stop time less than start time.

remarks.para: By default, a media item plays from the beginning to the end of the file. This method adjusts the start time and/or the stop time:

item.description: To set the start time, pass non-NULL values for pguidStartPositionType and pvStartValue.
To set the stop time, pass non-NULL values for pguidStopPositionType and pvStopValue.

remarks.para: The pguidStartPositionType and pguidStopPositionType parameters give the units of time that are used. Currently, the only supported value is MFP_POSITIONTYPE_100NS.

item.description:
100-nanosecond units. The time parameter (pvStartValue or pvStopValue) uses the following data type:
Variant type (vt): VT_I8
Variant member: hVal
To clear a previously set time, use an empty PROPVARIANT (VT_EMPTY).

remarks.para: The adjusted start and stop times are used the next time that is called with this media item. If the media item is already set on the player, the change does not happen unless you call SetMediaItem again.

member.seealso: How to Play a File Clip

summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Selects or deselects a stream.

param.name: dwStreamIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the stream. To get the number of streams, call .

param.name: fEnabled
param.para: Specify whether to select or deselect the stream.

description.para: The stream is selected. During playback, this stream will play.
The stream is not selected. During playback, this stream will not play.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: You can use this method to change which streams are selected. The change goes into effect the next time that is called with this media item. If the media item is already set on the player, the change does not happen unless you call SetMediaItem again with this media item.

summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Sets a media sink for the media item. A media sink is an object that consumes the data from one or more streams.

param.name: dwStreamIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of a stream on the media source. The media sink will receive the data from this stream.

param.name: pMediaSink
param.para: IUnknown pointer that specifies the media sink. Pass in one of the following:

item.description: A pointer to a stream sink. Every media sink contains one or more stream sinks. Each stream sink receives the data from one stream. The stream sink must expose the interface.

A pointer to an activation object that creates the media sink. The activation object must expose the interface. The media item uses the first stream sink on the media sink (that is, the stream sink at index 0).
NULL. If you set pMediaSink to NULL, the default media sink for the stream type is used.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: By default, the MFPlay player object renders audio streams to the Streaming Audio Renderer (SAR) and video streams to the Enhanced Video Renderer (EVR). You can use the SetStreamSink method to provide a different media sink for an audio or video stream; or to support other stream types besides audio and video. You can also use it to configure the SAR or EVR before they are used.
Call this method before calling . Calling this method after SetMediaItem has no effect, unless you stop playback and call SetMediaItem again.
To reset the media item to use the default media sink, set pMediaSink to NULL.

If the application is running over Remote Desktop, and you call this method with a non-NULL value for an audio or video stream, MFPlay disables remote playback optimizations. This remark applies only to audio and video streams. It does not apply to streams that contain some other data type, such as text.

summary.para: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
Stores an application-defined value in the media item.

param.name: dwUserData
param.para: The application-defined value.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: This method can be called after the player object is shut down.

summary.para: Note Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.

Represents a media item. A media item is an abstraction for a source of media data, such as a video file. Use this interface to get information about the source, or to change certain playback settings, such as the start and stop times. To get a pointer to this interface, call one of the following methods:
